abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            strengthening the banking system to promote rural
            investments in Vietnam. Term lending to rural areas was
            insufficient to lift a large proportion of the rural
            population out of poverty. Rural Finance Projects financed a
            wide range of rural investments to 4.45 million families and
            small enterprises whose net incomes rose by an average of 65
            percent. Investment lending by twenty five participating
            financial institutions to private rural entrepreneurs
            increased fourteen-fold and the volume of lending to the
            poor and to micro-enterprises jumped 250 percent. The
            quality and range of financial services improved, and all
            participating institutions improved their risk and credit
            management system.
